page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Origins of the name{"Oughtibridge" could be "Witte" the Anglo Saxon word for punishment, meaning a bridge of punishment or a corruption of "Atte",meaning "at the" or"near the" bridge.There was a bridge at this place mentioned in the Convention of 1161. In 1328 Robert Outebridge was one of the canons of Nostell Priory.The ancient hamlet of{Onesacre lies to the west of Oughtibridge, and prior to the Norman Conquest formed part of the lands of Godric the last Saxon owner."Anesacre" is mentioned in the Domesday Book as being the King's land.{Wharncliffe Side}lies to the north of Oughtibride,the lands being formerly owned by the Earls of Wharncliffe.
